decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The operations would consist of the enlargement of a dwelling house within the meaning of Class A of Part 1 of Schedule 2 to the Town & Country Planning (General Permitted Development)  (England) Order 2015 "the Order" and would comply with the development tolerances set out in said Class A. The operation would therefore have been granted planning permission by Article 3 of the Order.

Condition : 2 - Approved Plans - The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans::
Drawing no.19EDNA-XX-ZxXX-DR-A-0001/Rev P01(Location Plan) Dated 19/02/2025 
Drawing no.19EDNA-XX-ZxXX-DR-A-0011/Rev P02(Proposed Sitewide Ground Floor Plan) Dated 19/02/2025 
Drawing no. 19EDNA-XX-ZxXX-DR-A-0021/Rev P02 (Proposed Front Elevation Plan & Proposed Rear Elevation Plan) Dated 19/02/2025 
Drawing no. 19EDNA-XX-ZxXX-DR-A-0022/Rev P01 (Proposed Side Elevations 01 Plan) Dated 19/02/2025 
Drawing no. 19EDNA-XX-ZxXX-DR-A-0023/RevP01 (Proposed Side Elevations 02 Plan, Amended) Dated 19/02/2025.
Drawing no: 19EDNA-XX-ZxXX-DR-A-0031/RevP01(& Proposed Sections A-A Long Section Plans) Dated 11/02/2025 
Site Photographs 01 (Front Elevation) And Site Photograph 02 (Rear Elevation and Rear Garden) .

Condition : 3 - 1.It is a requirement of paragraph A.3 of the above legislation that the materials used in any exterior work (other than materials used in the construction of the conservatory) shall be of a similar appearance to those used in the construction of the exterior of the existing dwellinghouse.

Condition : 4 - 2..It is a requirement of Condition A.4 that the development shall be carried out in accordance with the information that the developer provided to the Local Planning Authority, unless the local planning authority and the developer agree otherwise in writing. It is a requirement of Condition A.4 that the development shall be carried out in accordance with the submitted drawings and information that the developer provided to the local planning authority, unless the local planning authority and the developer agree otherwise in writing.

Condition : 5 - ADVICE NOTE
(1)It is no longer a requirement that the development shall be completed on or before 30th May 2019.

Condition : 6 - (2)It is no longer a requirement that the developer notifies the local planning authority of the completion of the development as soon as reasonably practicable after completion, in writing including (a) the name of the developer, (b) the address or location of the development, and (c) the date of completion.

Condition : 7 - INFORMATIVE (Party Wall Act) - The applicant is advised to check the requirements of the Party Wall Act 1996 relating to work on an existing wall shared with another property, building on the boundary with a neighbouring property, or excavating near a neighbouring building. Further information is available at the following link: 
https://www.gov.uk/party-walls-building-works

Condition : 8 - INFORMATIVE
Note to Applicant -Approved Schemes
In accordance with paragraph 38 of the National Planning Policy Framework, London Borough of Merton (LBM) takes a positive and proactive approach to the delivery of sustainable development, by:
1. Providing a formal pre-application advice service, details to be found on Planning pre-application advice service on LBM's website
2. Providing written policies and guidance, which is available to view on LBM's website.
3. Where appropriate, negotiating amendments to secure a positive decision.
4. Determining applications in a timely manner including providing a fast track service, details to be found on Get a quicker planning decision on LBM's website.

In this instance:
i) The application was acceptable as submitted, and approved [without delay/ with an agreed determination date].

ii) The application was amended following negotiations with the Council to ensure the scheme complied with adopted policy and guidance, and a decision was made [without delay/ with an agreed determination date].

iii) The application was recommended for approval and referred to the first available Planning Committee, where the agents / applicants had an opportunity to present the application.
description: APPLICATION FOR PRIOR APPROVAL IN RESPECT OF THE PROPOSED ERECTION OF A SINGLE STOREY REAR EXTENSION WITH A DEPTH OF 3.38M, MAXIMUM HEIGHT OF 3.6M AND EAVES HEIGHT OF 2.82M.
